column5: Hey Guys  Here is an early season pike I caught on the a pink x-rap in the moon river area! Caught about 5 pike that size and a couple bass by accident but all were  released    Then me and a couple friends headed up to Net lake in the Temagami area and hooked into some nice smallies and a couple pike            Found this guy all alone in the middle of the lake! Almost hit him with the boat saw the beaver dam by the shore so gave him a lift to safety!    Went camping near Killbear Provincial Park and hooked some of these nice bass on Flipping Jigs! All of them in about 5 feet of water around logs      And of course the Worlds Greatest Sport Fish! The always great fighter the rock bass!
Nice fish, but that's really bizarre grabbing a baby beaver in the middle of the lake. Cool picture
WTG Minnow, alot of really nice fish there , good to see your trips went so well. Also nice of you to offer a ride to the little guy from the middle of the lake.
....Those are some impressive bass. Well done.
great report and by far one of the strangest catches of the year ! TB
great report and cool shot of the beaver
Some nice fish, good report...
Awesome report buddy. More great fish!    Interesting camo choice for the area you're fishing..
Great report!  Some great bass shots there and that beaver...well that's something you just dont see every day!!!!
Some nice bass there!
Great Report...  Love the beaver pic!!
Fantastic, as always.  Great beaver pic. However, the musky guys are getting cruel ideas...........
Great stuff, some beauty fish there and that beaver pic kills me - little guy has a definite "how the hell did I end up here" look to him.
very nice report, thanks for sharing!
Nice Beaver.  Sherriff
Every post should feature a little beaver    Great report and pictures, thanks for sharing.
Man those are alot of nice bass minnow!!!!!Good job!  oh by the way...Sorry but your grandpa's bass is bigger.
Nice pics.  Just wondering how "early" those bass were caught as i'm pretty sure there's leaves on the trees by the end of June.
nice fish man ...some true hogs...lol.but i agree with brookieman those first largies are out of season...oh well im sure they went right back on there beds ....nice report
granpa looks a little over dressed for bassin lol.nice job on those fish grab as much beaver as u can man
Awesome...Big..Bass !!!!!!!   right on guys,great report & pics,  thats what i call a great few days on the water,thanks for sharing,man those are big buckets & smallies...cheers
Save the trees.. Eat beaver..  Well done dude!  cheers HD

Sorry guys for posting the first too pics of the largies, I forgot the policy of no OOS fish! Hope I didn't offend anyone won't happen again and took the pics down! We were actually targeting pike with my grandpa in a small inlet of moon river and happened to hook these two nice buckets by accident. I can assure you that they were quickly released! I put up the pike picture instead it is not as big as the bass but I can assure you it is in season! Sorry once again and I hope that the beaver pic is not an OOS catch will check the regs but he was a live release LOL!
Nice wack of fish and Beaver  MTP
